channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Alcaraz-Sinner Rivalry Is Kicking Off A New Generation Of Tennis Greats
item.description: The next golden age of men’s tennis is unfolding before our very eyes, and that should make everyone happy — including the pickleball players.

item.title: Auditors Downplay Tens Of Thousands Registered To Vote Without Proof Of Citizenship In Oregon
item.description: Auditors found one in 35 voters didn’t have proof of citizenship — then looked the other way.

item.title: Why the Fed Should Cut Rates Now
item.description: The economy is poised to grow. The job now falls to the Fed and Treasury to cut, sell, and coordinate before the window of opportunity closes.

item.title: Hospitals Can’t Keep Hiding Their Prices from Patients
item.description: Many Americans have no way of knowing how much a hospital will charge them for a routine procedure until weeks later when the bill arrives in the mail...

item.title: Why Prudes Are The Only Ones Consistently Having Good Sex
item.description: Human flourishing consists less of discovering who we are than of becoming who we ought to be.

item.title: In their own words: Trump, Patel, Bongino and Bondi on the Epstein scandal
item.description: When Jeffrey Epstein died in prison, then-President Donald Trump speculated that authorities might be wrong in ruling it a suicide.

item.title: Report: America’s Debt Situation Will Soon Be Worse Than Right After World War II
item.description: Our country cannot get its fiscal house in order unless and until it starts slowing the explosion of Medicare spending.

item.title: Republican senators caution Trump against firing Fed chair Jerome Powell
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is gaining some key backing on Capitol Hill from GOP senators who fear the repercussions if President Donald Trump...

item.title: Adults Obsessively Buying Collectable Dolls Is A Symptom Of A Sick Culture
item.description: American adults' obsession with immaturity is far more dangerous than nostalgia.

item.title: Trump hosts Persian Gulf leaders at White House as new violence raises questions about peace efforts
item.description: President Donald Trump hosted a pair of Arab Gulf leaders at the White House on Wednesday as violence between Israel and Syria renewed doubts about hi...

item.title: Berthe Weill: Tigress Dealer for the Young Picasso, Matisse, and Chagall
item.description: Montreal’s fine-arts museum rediscovers Paris’s premiere talent spotter.

item.title: The End Is Still Near
item.description: Birth rates are falling, but Paul Ehrlich, who famously coined the term ‘the population bomb,’ is unmoved by the data.

item.title: Senate passes $9 billion in spending cuts to public broadcasting, foreign aid requested by Trump
item.description: The Senate has passed about $9 billion in federal spending cuts requested by President Donald Trump, including deep reductions to public broadcasting ...

item.title: Schiff mortgage fraud probe could end in stiff fines, penalties for senator
item.description: The type of mortgage fraud case in which Sen. Adam Schiff is now entangled is usually clear-cut and hard to wiggle out of, said financial crimes exper...
